Programmes showing miracles have disappeared from screens in compliance with an edict from the Nigeria's National Broadcasting Commission, which took effect from
continuation: last week . The Commission said it was acting on a complaint from a religious group , the Christian Association of Nigeria ( CAN ) ." The National Broadcasting Commission has ordered all broadcast broadcasters in the nation not to air any shows or shows that promote miracles or miracles in any form , " the commission said in a statement . " The Commission has additionally directed all broadcast broadcasters not to air any show or programme that supports wonders or miracles in any form . "Nigeria is one of the most religious nations in the world , with more than 80 per cent of the inhabitants professing to be Christian .

However , the TEA and the TSB have been accused of using the standards as a political tool to promote their own agendas .In this instance , the TEA and the TSB have decided to alter the standards to align with the Trump administration ' s social studies curriculum . The Trump administration has pushed for a " patriotic instruction " perspective to social studies teaching .The guidelines are meant to be a guide for schools to use when they teach the social studies curriculum . The guidelines do not , however , specify how the social studies curriculum should be taught .Instead , the standards emphasize on how children should think about the social studies curriculum . The cast of the new show has yet to be announced, but it's safe to say that we can expect the regular cast of main characters to return, as well as a new group of survivors. And it's safe to say that the show will take place next year. It's set in the same universe as the original Walking Dead, so we can expect some familiar faces to make an appearance. Zombies on a Plane is expected to premiere sometime in 2019.

translation: You may remember the tragic story of weekly newspaper editor Chauncey Bailey, who was murdered on his way to work in Oakland, California, on August 2nd. Police arrested him soon after the killing and believe it was racially motivated. It is unclear whether this was a hate crime, as the person who committed the murder had previously been the subject of anti-Semitic attacks. The motive for the attack is still under investigation. But one thing is clear: Bailey's murder was a crime. "This is a tragedy," San Francisco District Attorney Aaron Peskin said. This is a terrible disaster. Baileys' killing is one of several recent attacks on journalists of color. In April, a Jewish man was shot and killed at a kosher grocery store in Jersey City, North Carolina. J. In December, a Jewish man was stabbed to death in a synagogue in Poway, California. And in October, a man was shot and killed outside a synagogue in Pittsburgh. Peskin says it's not just Jews who are persecuted. It concerns all of us. This is a tragedy. Bailey was the longtime editor of the quarterly Oakland Tribune.

Captain Steve

Thousands of people march in Istanbul and around the world over raid on Gaza convoy.
Palestinians in the occupied West Bank clashed with Israeli security forces who responded with tear gas, injuring many people.
An emergency session of the United Nations Security Council
continuation: was asked for later on Friday to debate the latest events in Gaza , where Israel has launched dozens of aircraft attacks in the previous 24 hours . The Israeli army said it had hit Hamas targets in the Gaza Strip , notably a " terrorist tunnel " used by terrorists to carry out attacks .The army said it had killed a senior commander of Hamas ' s military wing in the strikes . Hamas ' s armed wing , the Izz el - Din al - Qassam Brigades , said in a statement it was " surprised " by the Israeli air attacks , which it said were a " violation of international law " .The Israeli army said the strikes were in reaction to a rocket assault on the Israeli city of Ashkelon on Thursday . " The IDF will continue to act in compliance with its right to self - defence , " it said in a statement .The UN Security Council is expected to consider the latest events later on Friday . The United States , Israel ' s closest ally , has say it is open to a ceasefire but is not ready to negotiate with Hamas , which it said is a terrorist organisation .The UN Security Council will also conduct an emergency meeting on Friday to consider the latest events in Gaza . translation:
Thousands of people are marching in Istanbul and around the world following attacks on convoys to Gaza.
Palestinians clashed with Israeli security forces in the occupied West Bank, and Israeli security forces responded with tear gas, injuring many people.
Late on Friday, it was proposed to convene an emergency meeting of the United Nations Security Council to discuss the latest developments in the Gaza Strip, where Israel has carried out dozens of airstrikes in the past 24 hours. The Israeli military said it had attacked Hamas targets in the Gaza Strip, including the "Tunnel of Terror" used by terrorists in the attack. The military said the attack killed a senior commander in Hamas's military wing. In a statement, the Hamas militant group Izz al-Din al-Qassam Brigades said it was "alarmed" by the Israeli airstrike, calling it a "violation of international law." The Israeli military said the attack was a response to Thursday's rocket attack on the Israeli city of Ashkelon. "The IDF continues to act in accordance with the right of self-defense," the organization said in a statement. The UN Security Council is expected to consider the latest developments later on Friday. The United States, Israel's closest ally, said it was ready for a ceasefire but not ready to negotiate with Hamas, which it claims is a terrorist organization. The United Nations Security Council is also scheduled to hold an emergency meeting on Friday to consider a ceasefire. Latest events in Gaza.

translation:
The fight against Ottawa's proposed tax changes for small businesses is far from over, even after months of backlash from the business community led to relief measures being proposed in the latest federal budget.
The Small Business Tax Fairness Coalition, a group of small business owners and entrepreneurs, announced Tuesday that it will continue to fight against proposed tax reform that would raise the top marginal tax rate for small businesses from 15% to 20%. "We will continue to fight to ensure small businesses are not left out of the Trudeau government's tax changes," said Dan Kelly, president of the group. "As we demonstrated in the last budget, the Trudeau Liberals are prepared to make changes to small business taxes." It's politics, but not the tax system for big business. Mr Kelly believed that the tax changes introduced could have a devastating impact on small businesses, especially small businesses. He added that the proposed tax changes could also have a negative impact on small and medium-sized enterprises that are able to compete with large corporations. This opinion piece is by Valarie Kaur, a civil rights lawyer, filmmaker, and interfaith leader who founded Groundswell, the nations largest multi-faith online organizing community.
Gunshots in a sanctuary of peace. C
continuation: ries of pain and anguish . A call to action .These are the sounds of the previous week and a half , as we mourn the losing of life in a mass shooting at two mosques in Christchurch , New Zealand , and as we answer to the pain and grief of our Muslim brothers and siblings . On March 15 , 2019 , a lone gunman began firing at two mosques in Christchurch , New Zealand , killing 50 people and injuring dozens more .The shooter livestreamed the attack on Facebook , which has since been took down . The massacre was the deadliest attack on Muslims in New Zealands history , and it was the deadliest attack on any faith in New Zealands history .In the aftermath of the attack , New Zealands Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern issued a state of emergency and called for a national date of mourning . She also called for a ban on the selling of semi - automatic guns .The day of mourning was followed by a string of activities in Christchurch , comprising a vigil for the victims , a march to Parliament , and a candlelight vigil at the Al Noor mosque . These activities were conducted in solidarity with the Muslim community in New Zealand and around the world .
translation:
This article was written by Valarie Kaul, a civil rights attorney, filmmaker, and interfaith leader who founded Groundswell, the nation's largest multifaith online community of organizers.
Shots were fired into the sanctuary of peace. Screams of pain and agony. call to action. These have been the sounds of the past week and a half in response to the pain and grief of our Muslim brothers and sisters as we mourn the lives lost in the mass shootings at two mosques in Christchurch, New Zealand. And my brothers and sisters. On March 15, 2019, a lone gunman opened fire on two mosques in Christchurch, New Zealand, killing 50 people and injuring dozens more. The attacker live-streamed the attack on Facebook, which has since been deleted. The massacre was the worst attack on Muslims in New Zealand's history, and the worst attack on faith in New Zealand's history. Following the attack, New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern declared a state of emergency and called for a national system to be established. On her day of mourning, she also called for a ban on the sale of semi-automatic rifles. The day of remembrance in Christchurch was followed by a series of events, including a vigil for the victims, a march to Parliament and a candlelight vigil at Al Noor Mosque. . These events were held in solidarity with Muslim communities in New Zealand and around the world.

He has to think about what to do with his life. Baker, who has a son and two daughters, doesn't know what his future holds, but he said he is determined to do his best. "He needs to think about what he's going to do," Baker says. He has to think about what to do with his life. Baker, who was born in New York and has lived in Los Angeles for 20 years, has been discussing his future with his family, he said. "He needs to decide what he's going to do," Baker says. "We need to decide what to do."

translation: "Right now, a lot of the mobile industry is focused on identifying where whales are getting the most advertising," says Jeffrey Peden. This appears to be a true statement given the amount of activity Boston has seen recently with major mobile advertisers. But Pedens isn't the only one who thinks so. In fact, some of the world's largest mobile marketers are starting to see similar changes in their businesses. "There's a lot more focus on content," said Mark Muro, his CEO at mobile advertising channel AdMob. "I think there's a lot more emphasis on content across the board," Muro said of a recent Adobe study that found that top mobile marketers are now focusing more on content than advertising. Advertisers see content as a way to interact with viewers, Muro says. They don't see it as a way to buy impressions. That doesn't mean they don't want to buy. input: A new travel site called Rome2Rio launches today, the brainchild of two ex-Microsoft employees, Michael Cameron and Bernard Tschirren. The sites main innovation? Its vehicle agnostic, in a way
continuation: that enables users to search for and book taxis , railroads , cars , and even bikes . Rome2Rios mission is to make it easy for people to travel around the world , without having to bother about the logistics of finding the right travel .Rome2Rio was developed to be a one - stop shop for visitors , Cameron says in a statement . We wanted to create a place where someone could book stuff from flights to trains to taxis , without having to bother about the details .Cameron and Tschirren have been collaborating on Rome2Rio for the previous year , and the sites launch is a culmination of their efforts . The pair collaborated at Microsoft for six years , and Cameron says he and Tschirren decided to do something different after leaving the company .Rome2Rio is the brainchild of two ex - Microsoft workers , Michael Cameron and Bernard Tschirren . Weve been collaborating on Rome2Rio for the previous year , and the sites launch is a culmination of our initiatives , Cameron says .The site
translation: A new travel site called Rome2Rio, the brainchild of former Microsoft employees Michael Cameron and Bernard Chirren, launched today. What is the main innovation of this site? It is vehicle independent, allowing users to search and book taxis, trains, cars and even bicycles. Rome2Rios' mission is to make it easy for people to travel around the world without worrying about the logistics of finding the right trip. Prime Minister David Cameron said in a statement that Rome2Rio was designed to be a one-stop shop for visitors. We wanted to create a place where you can book plane, train, and taxi tickets without worrying about the details. Cameron and Chirren have been working together on Rome2Rio for the past year, and the launch of this site is the culmination of their efforts. The two worked together at Microsoft for six years, and Cameron said that after leaving the company, he decided to do something different. Rome2Rio is the brainchild of two former Microsoft employees, Michael Cameron and his colleague Bernard Chirren. We partnered with Rome2Rio last year and the launch of this site is the culmination of our efforts, says Cameron.

But "Crazy" Carl G. Fisher --
continuation: who dying this week at age 97 - - would be even prouder . Fisher , who dying on Wednesday , was the visionary who thought up the Indianapolis 500 and the Indianapolis Motor Speedway .He also was the man who made certain it becoming the world ' s greatest sporting event . Fisher was one of the most important person in the history of the Indianapolis Motor Speedway .He helped bring the Indianapolis 500 back to Indianapolis after it was postponed in 1932 because of World War II . He was instrumental in coming the Indianapolis 500 to the United States for the first time in 1967 .Fisher also was the man who made certain the Indianapolis 500 becoming the world ' s greatest sporting contest . In 1966 , Fisher , then the president of the Indianapolis Motor Speedway , was approached by a group of shareholders who asked to bring the Indianapolis 500 to the United States .The consortium was led by the Indianapolis Motor Speedway ' s current president , Roger Penske . The investors needed to bring the Indianapolis 500 to the United States for the first time in 1967 .Fisher informed the investors he would be willing to sell the rights to the Indianapolis 500 to Penske and his group if they able get the Speedway to agree to a price . Fisher was also
translation:
The salesmen, showmen and visionaries who dreamed up the Indianapolis 500 would be proud. This weekend's 100th convention will feature its first official full house and largest gathering to date.
But Carl G. Fischer, the "madman" who died this week at the age of 97, would have been even prouder. Mr. Fisher, who died Wednesday, was a visionary of the Indianapolis 500 and Indianapolis Motor Speedway. He was also the man who made this race the greatest sporting event in the world. Fischer was one of the most important figures in the history of the Indianapolis Motor Speedway. He was instrumental in bringing back the Indianapolis 500 to Indianapolis, which had been postponed to his 1932 year due to World War II. He was instrumental in bringing the Indianapolis 500 to the United States for the first time in his 1967 year. Fisher is also the man who made the Indianapolis 500 the biggest sporting event in the world. In 1966, Fisher, then president of the Indianapolis Motor Speedway, was approached by his shareholder group to bring the Indianapolis 500 to the United States. The consortium was led by Roger Penske, current president of the Indianapolis Motor Speedway. Investors needed him to bring the Indianapolis 500 to the United States for the first time in 1967. Mr. Fisher told investors that he was willing to sell the rights to the Indianapolis 500 to Mr. Penske and his group if the racetrack could be persuaded to agree on a price. So was Fisher.

NOTTINGHAM  The sale of USA Springs property on Monday has been postponed for three months after the company filed for bankruptcy.
A representative from James St. James Auctioneers, of Manchester, which was scheduled to conduct the auction, confirmed company representatives
continuation: were unable to attend the selling . We were not able to attend the purchase because of the bankruptcy filing , the representative said .We will be rescheduling the selling for a later date . The corporation filing for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection in the U . S . Bankruptcy Court for the Southern District of New York on Sept . 9 .USA Springs , which was founded in 2008 , is a maker of high - end , custom - made spa products . The manufacturer is based in Manchester and has manufacturing locations in Connecticut , Pennsylvania , California and New York .The bankruptcy filing was first reported by the Wall Street Journal .
translation:
The sale of Nottingham U.S. Springs Real Estate was delayed for three months on Monday after the company filed for bankruptcy.
Representative of auction company James St. Manchester-based James Auctioneers, which was scheduled to conduct the auction, confirmed that a representative from the company was unable to attend the sale. A spokesperson said, ``Due to the bankruptcy filing, we were unable to participate in the acquisition.''Release date will be postponed to a later date. A company that has filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy in the United States. C. Bankruptcy Court for the Southern District of New York, September 9. 9. translation:
This week, banks gave preference to weekly deposits, and yields on these securities fell steadily, even as longer maturities saw an upward trend.

The yield on the 2-month Treasury note fell 2 basis points to 2.788 percent. The yield on the 30-month Treasury note fell 3 basis points to 3.109 percent. input: A glimmer of light is flickering at the end of a dark tunnel at Dundee, whose supporters' trust, Dee4Life, has co-ordinated a Company Voluntary Arrangement (CVA) to pull the Scottish First Division club
continuation: out of administration . However , the trust has now been given access to the details of the deal , which will saw the team ' s parent company , Dundee Football Club Limited , assume management of the team .Dee4Life has now been given the green light from the team ' s administrators to proceed with the CVA . translation: According to the EC, the first shameful development was the postponement of voting in two constituencies in the 2016 Tennessee Assembly elections due to the negative influence of money power. In a decisive indictment of the state's political class, the EC's decision to postpone elections in two constituencies for the 2016 assembly elections was met with a resounding 'no' from voters. In the first case, voting in Tiruvannamalai and South Tiruvannamalai constituencies was initiated due to the negative influence of money power. In the second instance, voting was initiated in Tiruvannamalai North constituency due to the negative influence of money power. The EC's decision to postpone elections in these two constituencies was met with strong rejection by voters. In Tiruvannamalai South district, elections were postponed due to the negative influence of money power. In the northern district of Tiruvannamalai, elections were postponed due to the negative influence of money power. In both cases, the EC's decision to postpone the vote was met with a resounding "no" from voters. Polls were held in South Tiruvannamalai constituency.

The first time they were detected , we thought , Oh , theyre just noise .Gravitational waves , which are also known as ripples in the fabric of space - time , were first anticipated by Albert Einstein in 1915 . translation: NEW YORK On a recent spring morning in the Utah desert, Jerry Foote received an excited email that showed two stars orbiting each other, with one star consuming the companion's material, due to gravity. Rudolph Novak received the same message, but from a different sender. Foote, a physicist at the University of California, Berkeley, and Nowak, an astrophysicist at the University of California, Santa Cruz, were two of the first scientists to identify gravitational waves, the ripples in space-time caused by the merger of two white particles. "It was a very exciting day," Foote explained. It was like, "Wow, I learned something." The observation of gravitational waves, reported in the journal Nature on Wednesday, broke new ground in science. Scientists have known for decades that black holes can cause ripples in space-time, but when they were first discovered in 2015, scientists weren't sure what to do with them. It's been a long time, Novak said. When they were first discovered, we thought, "Oh, it's just noise." Gravitational waves, also known as ripples in the fabric of space-time, were first predicted in 1915 by Albert Einstein.

TRUCKEE, Calif.  Property owners this week overwhelmingly approved a special tax to fund maintenance for the Brickelltown streetscape project.
At Tuesdays Truckee Town Council meeting, returned mailed ballots (30 out of 34
continuation: ) showed support for the taxation , which will be levied on property buyers in the Brickelltown area . If passed by voters , the taxation will be charged on the assessed value of property in the area , and will be paying by land owners .The tax will be assessed at $ 4 per $ 100 , 000 of assessed value , and will be levied on property buyers in Brickelltown , the Village of Truckee , and Truckee Meadows Community College . The tax is expected to produce about $ 1 . 5 million per month , which will be used to restore the streetscape project .The streetscape project will include the installation of sidewalks , road lights , landscaping , and other amenities . The project will also strengthen the pedestrian experience in the area , with the installation of a new pedestrian crossing at the intersection of Brickell Avenue and South Truckee Boulevard .The project is expected to be completed by the end of the year . For more information on the Brickelltown streetscape project , view the project page at https : / / www . truckeetown . org / brickelltown - streetscape / .
translation:
Truckee, California. Property owners overwhelmingly approved a special tax this week to fund maintenance of a Brickelltown streetscape project.
At Tuesday's Truckee City Council meeting, returned mail-in ballots (30 of 34) showed support for a tax on property buyers in the Brickelltown area. If passed by voters, the tax would be paid by landowners based on the assessed value of their properties in the area. The tax will be set at $4 per $100,000 of assessed value and will be levied on property buyers in Brickell Town, Truckee Village and Truckee Meadows Community College. The tax is expected to be about $1. $5 million per month will be used for urban landscape restoration projects. Streetscaping projects include installing sidewalks, street lights, landscaping, and other amenities. The project will also improve the pedestrian environment in the area by installing a new crosswalk at the intersection of Brickell Street and South Truckee Boulevard. The project is expected to be completed by the end of the year. For more information on the Brickelltown Streetscape Project, please visit the project page at https://www. Truckee Town. org/brickelltown-streetscape/.

continuation: Nuaimi , Secretary - General of the Council . translation: Senate President Chuck Morse plans to close a nearly $30 million budget shortfall caused by lawsuits over hospital payments. The family of the limousine driver involved in a deadly crash in upstate New York says they believe he was unwittingly assigned an unsafe vehicle.
The family of Scott Lisinicchia released a statement through their lawyer Tuesday asking the public to not
continuation: rush to judgment about the accident . Lisinicchia was driving a stretch limousine with six persons on board when it crashed in Schoharie , New York , on Saturday .Five of the passengers , including four teenagers , died . The familys lawyer , Robert Eglet , said the limousine had been allocated to Lisinicchias family for a birthday party .The lawyer stated the limousine was equipped with air packs and seatbelts , but the passengers did not wear them . Eglet stated the family believes Lisinicchia was ignorant of the safety features of the car .The National Transportation Safety Board is investigating the accident . translation:
The family of a limousine driver involved in a fatal crash in upstate New York said they believe he may have been wrongly assigned a dangerous vehicle.
On Tuesday, Scott Lisinicchia's family issued a statement through their attorney asking the public not to jump to conclusions about the case. Lisinicchia was driving a limousine carrying six people when the accident occurred Saturday in Schoharie, New York. Five passengers, including four teenagers, died. The family's attorney, Robert Egret, said the limousine was given to Lisinicchia's family for a birthday party. The limousine was equipped with airbags and seatbelts, but the passengers were not wearing them, the lawyer said. Egret said the family believes Lisinicchia was unaware of the car's safety features. The National Transportation Safety Board is investigating the accident. (Copyright (c) 2018 Sunbeam Television. The Associated Press contributed to this report. All rights reserved. This material may not be printed, broadcast, rewritten or redistributed.)

Over half of Europeans think that Israel now presents the biggest threat to world peace according to a controversial poll requested by the European Commission.
According to the same survey, Europeans believe the United States contributes the most to world instability along with Afghanistan, Iran,
continuation: and Russia . The survey , which was carried out by the European Commission ' s Directorate - General for Research , was presented to the European Parliament on Thursday .The survey was done by the European Commission ' s Directorate - General for Research , in partnership with the European Council on Foreign Relations ( ECFR ) . In a statement , the ECFR said that the poll revealed that there is a continuing divide between Europeans and Americans when it comes to world stability ." translation: At the AppsWorld developer conference, Oracle President Chuck Phillips spoke to about 10,000 customers and developers about the show's theme: software integration. In his opening remarks, Mr. Phillips pointed out that interoperability - the ability of software to work together with other software - is the number one driver of success for companies. He also said that Oracle's integration strategy is about more than just making software work together. It's important to have the best of both worlds. "We're trying to bring in the best," he said. We are trying to combine the best of both worlds. This does not mean that Oracle's activities are not limited to application integration. The company is also working on a set of new Web services that will allow customers to connect users to other computers. Phillips said the new suite of web services will launch later this year and will allow customers to do everything they couldn't do before. Phillips also said that Oracle is working on a new database that will allow customers to connect their applications to other databases. The database, called "Oracle E-Business Suite," will be available later this year and will allow customers to connect their applications to other databases.

Atletico Madrid and France forward Antoine Griezmann has taken home the award for the best player in La Liga last season.
But the glitzy awards ceremony in Valencia was overshadowed with no Barcelona players attending after manager Luis Enrique was overlooked
continuation: for the honor for best manager . Griezmann , who joined Atletico from Atletico Madrid in the spring of 2015 , scored 29 goals in all competitions last season .Barcelona were defeated by Real Madrid in the Champions League final in Cardiff , Wales , in May . translation:
Atltico Madrid's French forward Antoine Griezmann won last season's La Liga Player of the Year award.
However, the glittering ceremony in Valencia was marred by the absence of Barcelona's players, as Luis Enrique was stripped of the title of best manager. Griezmann, who joined from Atletico Madrid in the spring of 2015, scored 29 goals in all competitions last season. Barcelona lost to Real Madrid in the Champions League final in Cardiff, Wales, in May. Griezmann won the Ballon d'Or in 2016 and was named FIFA's best player in the world last season.

KINSHASA Democratic Republic of Congo's top court on Monday definitively excluded opposition leader Jean-Pierre Bemba from December's presidential election because of a witness tampering conviction at the International Criminal Court.
KINSHASA Congolese
continuation: court rejects presidential candidate Jean - Pierre Bemba ' s appeal Bemba , who is serving a 15 - year sentence for crimes against humanity in The Hague , appealed the judgement to the Constitutional Court , which on Monday refused his petition . " The Constitutional Court of the Democratic Republic of Congo has refused the appeal of Jean - Pierre Bemba to the Constitutional Court of the Republic of Congo , " the court said in a statement .Bemba , who was once a close allies of President Joseph Kabila , has been one of the most vocal critics of Kabila ' s decision to stay in authority beyond the end of his mandate in December 2016 . He is one of several opposition figures barred from running in the Dec . 23 election , which is seen as a major test of the stability of the vast central African country .The court ' s decision to eliminate Bemba was " not a surprise , " commented Bemba ' s spokesman , Jean - Jacques Muyembe . " We had hoped that the Constitutional Court would be able to find a way out of this situation , " he informed Reuters .Bemba ' s attorneys had argued that the court had no jurisdiction over his case because the ICC had not given an arrest warrant for

The Democratic Republic of Congo's Kinshasa Supreme Court on Monday permanently banned opposition leader Jean-Pierre Bemba from the December presidential election for fabricating a witness' conviction at the International Criminal Court.
Kinshasa His Congolese court has rejected the appeal of presidential candidate Jean-Pierre Bemba. Bemba, who is serving a 15-year sentence for crimes against humanity in The Hague, appealed the sentence to the Constitutional Court, which rejected his request on Monday. "The Constitutional Court of the Democratic Republic of the Congo has dismissed Jean-Pierre Bemba's appeal to the Constitutional Court of the Democratic Republic of the Congo," the court said in a statement. Mr Bemba, once a close ally of President Joseph Kabila, has been one of the most vocal critics of Mr Kabila's decision to remain in power after his term ends in December 2016. He is one of several opposition MPs banned from running in December. The March 23 election is seen as a major test of stability in the giant Central African country. The court's decision to dismiss Bemba was "not surprising," Bemba's spokesman Jean-Jacques Muyembe said in a statement. "I was hoping that the Constitutional Court would find a way out of this situation," he told Reuters. Bemba's lawyer argued that the court had no jurisdiction over his case because the ICC had not issued an arrest warrant.

A motorcyclist from Worthing suffered fatal injuries following a collision with two cars on the A286 in Birdham, near Chichester, yesterday.
The 56-year-old motorcyclist from Worthing collided with a Jaguar travelling in
continuation: the opposite direction on the A286 at around 9 . 30am . The motorcyclist was taken to hospital where he died a brief time later .His next of kin have been informed . The driver of the Jaguar , a 48 - month - old guy from Chichester , was not injured .The road was closed for several hours while emergency services dealt with the incident . A Sussex Police spokesman said : " We are appealing for anyone who seen the accident or who might have dash cam footage of the area at the time to come in touch . "Anyone with info is told to phone 101 quoting serial 549 of 16 / 02 .
translation:
A Worthing motorcyclist was fatally injured in a two-vehicle collision on the A286 at Birdham, near Chichester, yesterday.
At around 9am, a 56-year-old motorcyclist from Worthing collided with an oncoming Jaguar on the A286. 3.30am. The motorcyclist was taken to the hospital, where he died shortly after. His closest relatives reported this. The driver of the Jaguar, a 48-month-old male from Chichester, was not injured. The road was closed for several hours while emergency services dealt with the incident. A Sussex Police spokesperson said: "We are appealing for anyone who witnessed the incident or has dashcam footage of the scene to contact us." Anyone with information should call him on 101, quoting serial number 549 of 16/2002. .

input:
Gloucester claimed their second win of the season to impose a third defeat of the fledgling campaign on Wasps.
Stephen Jones put Wasps 3-0 ahead before two Freddie Burns penalties and a converted James Simpson-Daniel try gave the hosts a
continuation: bonus - point win . Wasps were in the ascendancy after a exciting opening period , but Gloucester were in control after the broke .Gloucester ' s Freddie Burns celebrates scoring his side ' s second try against Wasps ( Steven Paston / PA ) Jones ' club , who have won just one of their opening seven Premiership matches , were reduced to 14 men after just five moments when scrum - half Dan Robson was shown a yellow card for a high tackle on Wasps captain Tom Youngs . But they were still in control at the broke after Burns converted Simpson - Daniel ' s try to make it 3 - 0 .Gloucester , who have won just one of their opening seven Premiership matches , made a bright start to the second half , with Burns adding a penalty to make it 3 - 3 . But Wasps were not to be denied , with Simpson - Daniel taking a third penalty to make it 10 - 3 .Gloucester , who are now without a win in their opening seven Premiership matches , were reduced to 14 men after just five minutes when scrum - half Dan Robson was shown a yellow card for a high tackle on Wasps captain Tom Youngs ( Steven Paston / PA )
translation:
Gloucester picked up their second win of the season, handing Wasps their third defeat of this young campaign.
Stephen Jones gave Wasps a 3-0 lead before Freddie Barnes converted two penalties and James Simpson-Daniel converted a try to give the hosts a bonus point victory. Wasps took the lead after a thrilling early game, but after the break Gloucester took control. Gloucester's Freddie Barnes celebrates scoring his team's second try against Jones' Wasps (Stephen Paston/Pennsylvania) team. The team has only won once. Scrum-half Dan Robson was given a yellow card for a heavy tackle on Wasps captain Tom Young after just five minutes, reducing their side to 14 points from their first seven Premier League games. However, they were still in the lead after Barnes scored a try for Simpson-Daniel to make it 3-0. Gloucester, who had won just one of their opening seven Premier League games, started the second half with a bang alongside Barnes. With the penalty added, the score was 3-3. However, Wasps' attack was not denied and Simpson-Daniel converted his third penalty to make it 10-3. Gloucester, winless in their opening seven Premier League games, were reduced to 14 men within the first five minutes. Midfielder Dan Robson receives a yellow card for a heavy tackle on Wasps captain Tom Young (Stephen Paston/Penn State).

Most of the candidates mounted successful primary campaigns by saying they would not be like

Hager is one of three Republicans standing for the three - year term .The other two are incumbent Democrat John Fetterman and independent candidate Bob Hagan . Hager is the only one of the three candidates who has a background in government .He worked as a vice county executive for four years before he was elected to the state House of Delegates in 2014 . He ' s been working as a county commissioner since 2015 .He ran for the state House of Delegates in 2014 and lost , but he won his seat in 2016 . Hager said he ' s the most conservative candidate in the race because he believes government should be smaller ." " Hager said he ' s also running because he ' s the only candidate who ' s not a politician ." I ' m not a politician , " Hager said . " I ' m not a career politician .I
translation:
Nearly three weeks after the primary that defeated two incumbents, the remaining candidates for Carroll County Commissioner are struggling to show voters that they are very different from each other.
Most candidates ran successful primary campaigns by declaring themselves different from their predecessors. But at least one candidate, incumbent Republican Commissioner Mark Hager, is trying to position himself as the most conservative candidate in the race. "I'm the most conservative incumbent," Hager said. Hager is one of three Republicans running for a three-year term. The other two candidates are incumbent Democrat John Fetterman and independent candidate Bob Hagan. Hager is the only one of the three candidates with experience in government. He served as his district vice president for four years and was elected state representative in 2014. He has served as a county commissioner since 2015. He ran unsuccessfully for state representative in 2014, but won the seat in 2016. Hager said he is the most conservative candidate in the race because he believes government should be small. "I'm the most conservative because I think government should be smaller," Hager said. "I think there should be less government. I think there should be less regulation." Hager said he is also running because he is the only candidate who is not a politician. Ta. "I'm not a politician," Hager said. . "I'm not a professional politician.

Argentina labor's umbrella organization CGT, has organized a strike for Monday to protest the economic reforms being implemented y the administration of president Mauricio Macri's business friendly administration.

continuation: Buenos Aires to oppose Macri ' s economic measures . The government believes the changes are necessary to revive the nation ' s stagnant economy , but the opposition believes they will hurt the poor and middle class .

Sharp saw sales drop 12 percent in the nine months to December as competition increased in the LCD panel and television markets, it said Wednesday.
The company saw demand for flat-screen TVs drop in markets outside of Japan and was also pinched by price
continuation: competition , it said in a statement . Sharp ' s shares have been damaged in recent months , declining more than 60 percent since the start of the month as the company grapples with a weak global economy and a slump in demand for LCD panels .
translation:
Sharp said Wednesday that sales fell 12% in the nine months to December due to increased competition in the LCD panel and TV markets.
The company said in a statement that it is facing declining demand for flat-screen TVs in markets outside Japan and price competition. Sharp's stock price has been depressed in recent months, dropping more than 60% since the start of the month as the company grapples with a weak global economy and declining demand for LCD panels.

input:
The glaring contradiction in Greeces government is producing a political crisis.
Left wing party Syriza was elected on an anti-austerity programme and now it is implementing the worst austerity measures yet.
To win a majority in parliament it is
continuation: now calling for a referendum on its own programme . But the referendum is a non - starter .It would taking a miracle for Syriza to reach a referendum on its own programme . The Greek people have already rejected the austerity measures .The only way Syriza can reach a referendum on its own programme now is to form a coalition cabinet with the right wing New Democracy group . But New Democracy is refusing to join Syriza .So Syriza has no choice but to call for a referendum on its own programme . This is a clear breach of the Greek constitution .The constitution tells that referendums must be held by the government . The constitution also said that referendums must be taken by a simple majority of the people .But Syriza is holding a referendum on its own programme . So what is the point of holding a referendum on its own programme ?Is it really a referendum on its programme ? Is it a referendum on the people ?Or is it a referendum on the government ? This is the question that the Greek people are ask themselves .If Syriza is going to hold a referendum on its own programme then it should also hold a referendum on the government  s
translation:
The Greek government's apparent contradictions have led to a political crisis.
The leftist party SYRIZA was elected on an anti-austerity platform and is currently implementing the worst austerity measures in history.
It is now calling for a referendum on its own plans in order to gain a majority in parliament. However, the referendum did not begin. It will take a miracle for SYRIZA to reach a referendum on its own plan. Greeks are already rejecting austerity measures. The only way Syriza can now force a referendum on its plans is by forming a coalition government with the right-wing group New Democracy. However, New Democracy refuses to join SYRIZA. SYRIZA therefore has no choice but to hold a referendum on its own plan. This is clearly a violation of the Greek constitution. The constitution stipulates that referendums must be conducted by the government. The constitution also provides that referendums must be held by a simple majority of the people. However, SYRIZA is holding a referendum on its own plans. So what is the point of holding a referendum on your program? Is this really a referendum on the plan? Is it a referendum? Or is this a referendum on the government? This is the question the Greek people are asking themselves. If SYRIZA is going to hold a referendum on its own plan, it should also hold a referendum on the government's plan.

Senior forward Bey
continuation: ana Smith leading the way with 20 points , while youth center Taylor Blevins added 15 points and seven rebounds . translation:
MORRISTOWN - Stewart Country Day School's girls basketball team defeated top-ranked Morristown Bird 71-63 in the NJISAA Prep B Tournament on Wednesday for its second straight championship.
Senior forward Beyanna Smith led the way with 20 points, and junior center Taylor Blevins added 15 points and seven rebounds. The score was tied 23-23 at the end of the first quarter, but Stewart outscored Morristown-Baird 16-8 in the second half to take a 42-32 lead at halftime. Stewart increased its lead to 17 points in the third quarter, but Morristown Bird cut the lead to six points in the fourth half.

translation:
JACKSONVILLE, Fla.  Police released photos of a vehicle they are searching for in connection to a robbery and shooting that occurred Wednesday at a BP gas station in Arlington.
Detectives say the gunman shot the business owner, who was not injured. The robbery happened at the BP gas station in the 5100 block of Northwest 29th Avenue. The victim told police the gunman pointed a gun at him and demanded cash. The victim told police he gave the man an undisclosed amount of money. The man then left the scene in a gold four-door sedan, according to the victim. Police say the victim's vehicle was stolen from a residence in Arlington. Anyone with information is asked to call the Jacksonville Sheriff's Office at 904-630-0500 or Crime Stoppers at 1-866-845-TIPS. Copyright 2018 WJXT News4Jax - All Rights Reserved.

THOUSAND OAKS, CA (RNN) - Less than two weeks after the Pittsburgh synagogue shooting that killed 11, another mass shooting has taken a dozen lives in California.
A gunman killed 12 people, including a sheriffs
continuation: deputy , at the Borderline Bar & Grill in Thousand Oaks on Wednesday day . The shooter , identified as Ian David Long , opened fire at the bar around 11 : 30 p . m . local time , according to the Ventura County Sheriff  s Office .Long was described as a 21 - month - old white man from Newbury Park , California , according to reports . The sheriff  s office stated he had a  long history of psychological disease ,  according to the Ventura County Star .Long was seized at the scene and has been charged with murder , attempted murder , attack with a semiautomatic firearm , possession of a firearm by a felon , and possession of a firearm by a prohibited people , according to the Ventura County Sheriff  s Office . He is being held without bail at the Ventura County Jail , according to the Ventura County Sheriff  s Office website .A motivation for the shooting has not already been released . This is a developing tale .Please check back for updates . Copyright 2018 Raycom News Network .All rights reserved .
translation:
THOUSAND OAKS, Calif. (RNN) - Less than two weeks after the Pittsburgh synagogue shooting that killed 11 people, a new mass shooting in California has left more than a dozen people dead.
A gunman killed 12 people, including a sheriff's deputy, at the Borderline Bar and Grill in Thousand Oaks on Wednesday. The gunman, identified as Ian David Long, fired shots into the bar around 11:30 p.m. m. local time, according to the Ventura County Sheriff's Office. According to reports, Long is described as a 21-month-old white male from Newbury Park, California. The sheriff's office said he had a long history of mental illness, the Ventura County Star reported. Long was captured at the scene and charged with murder, attempted murder, assault with a semi-automatic weapon and possession of a firearm by a felon. Possession of a firearm by a prohibited person, according to the Ventura County Sheriff's Office. He is being held without bail at the Ventura County Jail, according to the Ventura County Sheriff's Office website. The motive for the shooting has not yet been revealed. This is a developing story. stay tuned. Copyright 2018 Raycom News Network. All rights reserved.

input: Andrew P. Fitzgerald, 50, formerly of Plattsburgh, N.Y., passed away Tuesday, March 5, 2019, at Sarasota Memorial Hospital with his family by his side. He was born in Plattsburgh, N.Y.,
continuation: on May 21 , 1968 , brother of the late Robert Fitzgerald and Mary ( McNally ) Fitzgerald . Andrew was a alumnus of Plattsburgh High School , Class of 1987 .He was employed as a machinist at the Plattsburgh Navy Yard . Andrew loved fishing , hunting , and spending time with his family .He was a member of the Plattsburgh Moose Lodge . Andrew is survived by his loving wife of 20 decades , Linda ( Hansen ) Fitzgerald of Plattsburgh , N . Y . ; a son , Christopher Fitzgerald of Plattsburgh , N . Y . ; a son , Ashley Fitzgerald of Plattsburgh , N . Y . ; a brother , Robert Fitzgerald of Plattsburgh , N . Y . ; a brother , Susan Fitzgerald of Plattsburgh , N . He was born May 21, 1968 in Plattsburgh, New York, the brother of the late Robert and Mary (McNally) Fitzgerald. Andrew was a 1987 graduate of Plattsburgh High School. He worked as a machinist at the Plattsburgh Navy Yard. Andrew enjoyed fishing, hunting, and spending time with his family. He was a member of his Moose Lodge in Plattsburgh. Andrew is survived by his loving wife of 20 years, Linda (Hansen) Fitzgerald of Plattsburgh, NY; a son, Christopher Fitzgerald of Plattsburgh, N.S.; a son, Ashley Fitzgerald of Plattsburgh, NY; a brother, Robert Fitzgerald of Plattsburgh, N.S.; a brother, Susan Fitzgerald of Plattsburgh, N.S.; brother-in-law Robert Hansen of Plattsburgh, NY; and many nieces and nephews. In addition to his parents, Andrew was preceded in death by his brother, Robert Fitzgerald Jr.; ; and cousin Linda Fitzgerald. A Mass of Christian Burial will be celebrated at 10 a.m. On Friday, March 8, 2019, at St. Catholic Church of John the Baptist, pl.

translation: Former Kent State wrestling coach Ron Gray was inducted into the National Wrestling Hall of Fame on June 1 in Stillwater, Oklahoma. Gray, who coached the Golden Flashes for 25 seasons, is one of four members inducted into the Hall of Fame this year. Year . A native of Kent, Ohio, Gray was a four-time All-American at Kent State University and was a member of the school's first national championship team in 1985. In 2005, he was inducted into the Kent State Track and Field Hall of Fame. Gray's coaching career began in 1974 at Kent State University, where he served as an assistant coach. He was named head coach in 1978 and led the Flashes to the NCAA Division II national title in 1981. Gray became a coach at Ohio State University and led the Buckeyes to the school's first national championship in 1988. He led the Buckeyes to the NCAA Division II National Championship his fourth straight year from 1989 until 1992. Gray's last coaching job was at the University of Toledo, where he led the Rockets to the NCAA Division II National Championship in 2000 and 2001. QUITO, ECUADOREcuador election officials have agreed to recount nearly 1.3 million votes as opposition leader Guillermo Lasso continues to allege fraud in the presidential election.
The National Electoral Council announced late Thursday it would
continuation: conduct a recount of votes cast in the April 11 election . The council added the recount will be carried out over the last few days .Lasso has alleged fraud in the voting count and has called for a new election . The electoral council has indicated it will not change the result of the election .Lasso won 51 per cent of the voting in the first round of the election . A Tesco petrol station near Cambridge was raided today (February 28) by masked men, triggering a major police response.
Two men wearing hoods and masks were reported to have broken into the station at the Milton Tesco on Cambridge Road.
continuation: A heavy police cordon was placed in place , and officers from Cambridgeshire Police were called to the scene . The boys were last seen running from the scene .A spokesman for Cambridgeshire Police said : " We were called to a report of a break - in at a Tesco store in Milton , Cambridgeshire , this morning . " Two individuals carrying hoods and masks were reported to have broken into the store at around 8 . 30am ." The boys were last seen running from the scene . " Enquiries are continuing and anyone with data is told to phone police on 101 , quoting incident number 481 of 28 February . "Anyone with info can also contact Crimestoppers anonymously on 0800 555 111 .
translation:
A Tesco petrol station near Cambridge was attacked by masked men today (February 28), sparking a massive police response.
Two hooded and masked men are reported to have entered Milton Tesco station on Cambridge Road.
A heavy police cordon was set up and officers from Cambridgeshire Police were called to the scene. The boys were last seen running from the scene. A Cambridgeshire Police spokesperson said: "This morning we received reports of a break-in at a Tesco store in Milton, Cambridgeshire. Two people were reported to be wearing hoods and masks. The store was broken into around 8:30 a.m. The boys were last seen running from the scene. The investigation is ongoing and anyone with information is asked to call police on 101, quoting incident number 481 of February 28. Anyone with information can also contact Crimestoppers anonymously on 0800 555 111.

translation:
Driverless buses and other city vehicles will soon follow the path of a pioneering self-driving shuttle between the Calgary Zoo and Terrace Spark, city councilors announced Thursday.
The 12-person Electronic Autonomous Shuttle (EAS) was unveiled Thursday at the Calgary Zoo. The shuttle will run between the zoo and Terrace Spark on the east side of the zoo. This is the beginning of a journey for us, she said. "This is not just a pilot project. This is something that can be expanded to other areas of the city." This will help us work more efficiently. This ensures that our resources are used as efficiently as possible. "EAS is an unmanned van that can move at speeds of up to 30 kilometers per hour. It will also be equipped with cameras."

translation:
Daniel R. Welsh, 60, of Williamsfield, Ohio, passed away Sunday, October 20, 2013, at his home.
He was born March 22, 1953 in Pittsburgh, the son of Shirley L. (Gregory) Vidnick of Aliquippa, Pennsylvania, and the late Robert T. Welsh. He graduated from Aliquippa High School in his 1971 class. He was a member of St. Paul Lutheran Church, Williams Field. Daniel worked as a tractor driver for several decades. He was a member of the Williams Field Fire Department. He enjoyed hunting, fishing, camping and spending time with his family. He is survived by his wife of 43 years, Linda A. Welsh of Williamsfield; two sons, Michael Welsh of Williamsfield and Mark Welsh of Williamsfield; two brothers, Robert T. Welsh of Williamsfield and James L. Welsh of Florida; a brother, Judy M. (Bill) Smith of Williamsfield; brother-in-law, Mary Ann Welsh of Williamsfield; and many nieces and nephews. In addition to his parents, he was preceded in death by a brother, Robert T. Welsh, Jr.; Funeral services will be held at 11 p.m. On Saturday, October 26, 2013, at St. Paul Lutheran Church, Williams Field, with the Rev. John C. Smith officiating. Burial will be in St. Paul Lutheran Cemetery, Williams Field.

The Best Buy logo on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange in New York on Nov. 12, 2018.
In naming Corie Barry chief executive officer, Best Buy Co. hands the reins to the architect of its current growth strategy, widely
continuation: credited with turning around the struggling electronics chain . Barry , 53 , who has been Best Buy ' s chief financial officer since 2010 , will become CEO on Jan . 1 , 2019 , the company said Tuesday .She will succeed Hubert Joly , who will become executive chairman of the board . Barry will become the first woman to lead the company , which has been run by men since its establishment in 1962 .The new CEO will also be the first woman to lead a Fortune 500 company . " I am honored to lead Best Buy as we continue to evolve our business and transform the customer experience , " Barry said in a statement ." We have an incredible opportunity to build on our momentum and build long - term value for our clients , workers and shareholders . " Barry , who has been with Best Buy since 2006 , was elected CFO in 2010 .She has held a number of management roles at the company , including vice president of human resources , head information executive and chief operating executive . Best Buy ' s stock price has been on a tear since Joly took over as CEO in 2015 .The stock has gained virtually 50 % since then . translation:
On November 12, 2018, the Best Buy logo appeared on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange in New York.
By appointing Corey Barry as chief executive officer, Best Buy Co. is handing the reins to the architect of its current growth strategy, which is widely credited with saving the struggling electronics chain. Barry, 53, who has served as Best Buy's chief financial officer since 2010, will become CEO on January 1. The company announced this on Tuesday, January 1, 2019. She will succeed Hubert Joly, who will become executive chairman of the board. Barry will be the first woman to lead the company, which has been run by men since its founding in 1962. The new CEO is also the first woman to lead a Fortune 500 company and is "honored to lead Best Buy as we continue to grow the business and transform the customer experience," Barry said in a statement. . Ms. Barry has worked at Best Buy since 2006 and in 2010 she was elected Chief Financial Officer. She has held a number of leadership positions at the company, including Vice President of Human Resources, Chief Information Officer, and Chief Operating Officer. Best Buy's stock price has fallen significantly since Joly took over as CEO in 2015. Since then, the stock price has increased about 50%. She is credited with the revival of Jolie, who took over as CEO in 2015.

Traffic deaths in California fell 9 percent last year  the biggest drop in 14 years  and crashes on Highway 17 continued their nearly decadelong decline.
State officials attribute the decline in road-related deaths statewide to more Californians wearing their seat
continuation: belts , and to a sharp drop in the number of people driving drunk . But the number of people killed in crashes on the state  s freeways continues to climb , and the number of people killed on the state  s highways continues to rise .The amount of people killed in accidents on California  s freeways last year declined 9 percent from the previous year , the biggest drop in 14 decades , according to a report published Tuesday by the California Department of Transportation . The amount of people killed in accidents on the state  s freeways last month was just over 3 , 000 , a drop of 7 percent from the previous year , the report says .The amount of people killed in accidents on the state  s freeways in 2012 was just over 3 , 600 , an increase of 14 percent from the previous year . The amount of people killed in accidents on the state  s freeways in 2012 was the highest in more than a years .The amount of people killed in accidents on the state  s freeways in 2012 was the highest in more than a years .  We  re not out of the woods yet ,  Caltrans Director Brian Kelly told .
translation:
California traffic fatalities fell 9% last year, the largest drop in 14 years, and the number of crashes on Highway 17 continues to decline for the first time in nearly a decade.
State officials attribute the decline in traffic fatalities across the state to more Californians wearing seatbelts and a sharp drop in the number of drunk drivers. But the number of people killed in crashes on the state's highways continues to rise, and the number of people killed on the state's highways continues to rise. A report released Tuesday by the California Department of Transportation said last year saw the largest drop in traffic in 140 years. Just over 3,000 people died in crashes on the state's highways last month, down 7% from a year earlier, the report said. More than 3,600 people died in crashes on the state's highways in 2012, an increase of 14% from the previous year. The number of people killed in crashes on the state's highways in 2012 was the highest in recent years. The number of people killed in crashes on the state's highways in 2012 was the highest in recent years. "We're not out of the woods yet," Caltrans Director Brian Kelly said.

Years after his death, an anonymous letter has led to a suspect in the fatal hit-and-run that killed Baylor University sophomore David Grotberg.
Gabrielle Lyons was asking for $750,000 from the university in a lawsuit she
continuation: filed in 2015 , alleged that it failed to take care of Grotberg , who was struck by a vehicle as he strolled across the street . Grotberg , 20 , was pronounced dead at Baylor Medical Center in Waco , Texas , after being hit by a vehicle on Feb . 4 , 2015 .Lyons  lawsuit claimed that Baylor failed to take care of Grotberg , who had been diagnosed with schizophrenia , bipolar disorder and an eat disorder . The university settled the litigation in 2017 , agreeing to pay $ 1 . 5 million , according to the Waco Tribune - Herald .Lyons , who was not named in the litigation , said in a court filing that Grotberg was struck by a vehicle that was travelling erratically , and that she didn  t know the driver of the car . Grotberg had been walking across the street with a colleague when he was struck , the litigation said .Lyons said in her filed that she learned that the driver of the car that struck Grotberg was a Baylor student who had recently moved to Waco . Lyons said she needed Baylor to pay for Grotberg  s burial , as well as his mental health treatment .
translation:
Years after his death, an anonymous letter identified him as a suspect in the hit-and-run that killed Baylor University sophomore David Grotberg.
Gabriel Lyons filed a lawsuit in 2015 asking the university to pay him $750,000 for failing to care for Grotberg, who was hit by a car while crossing the street. Grotberg, 20, was pronounced dead on February 2 at Baylor Medical Center in Waco, Texas, after being hit by a car. Ryan's lawsuit alleges that Baylor failed to care for Grotberg, who was diagnosed with schizophrenia, bipolar disorder and an eating disorder. The university settled the lawsuit in 2017, agreeing to pay $1. 5 million, according to the Waco Tribune-Herald. Lyons, who is not named in the lawsuit, said in court documents that Grotberg was hit by an out-of-control car but did not know the driver. Grotberg was walking across the street with his co-worker when he was struck, according to the complaint. Lyons said in her filing that she learned the driver of the car that hit Grotberg was a Baylor student who had recently moved to Waco. Lyons said she wants Baylor to pay for Grotberg's funeral expenses and mental health treatment.

input: In all probability, the main Hazratganj crossing is likely to be named after former prime minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee, as the executive committee of the Lucknow Municipal Corporation, in a meeting on Friday, gave power to mayor
continuation: Rakesh Kumar Singh to naming the crossing after Vajpayee .  Vajpayee was one of the most popular politicians of the nation .We want to commemorate him by naming the Hazratganj crossing after him ,  says mayor Rakesh Kumar Singh .  It is not possible to naming Hazratganj crossing after the entire Hazratganj neighborhood .Therefore , we have decided to naming it after Vajpayee ,  he added . The decision to naming the crossing after Vajpayee was taken at a conference of the executive commission of the Lucknow Municipal Corporation on Friday .Vajpayee , who was the prime secretary of India between 1996 and 2004 , died on August 16 . The Lucknow Municipal Corporation has already designated Hazratganj crossing after ex leader Pranab Mukherjee .
translation: Perhaps the main junction in Hazratganj is likely to be named after former prime minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee as the Lucknow Municipal Corporation's executive committee in a meeting on Friday authorised Mayor Rakesh Kumar Singh to name the junction after Vajpayee. Vajpayee was one of the most popular politicians in the country. "We want to honour his memory by naming the junction Hazratganj after him," Mayor Rakesh Kumar Singh said. We cannot name Hazratganj junction after the entire Hazratganj district. So, we have decided to name it after Vajpayee," he added. The decision to name the junction after Vajpayee was taken at the Lucknow Municipal Corporation's executive committee meeting on Friday. Vajpayee, who served as India's prime minister from 1996 to 2004, passed away on August 16. The Lucknow Municipal Corporation has already named Hazratganj junction in honour of its former leader Pranab Mukherjee.

Button-up shirts and khaki slacks work for men or women.
Dress codes at work can be confounding. Offices have loosened up and introduced business
continuation: - casual dress codes , but what exactly is business - casual or fancy - casual dress dress ? The answer , according to clothing experts , is that dress codes vary depending on the company and the culture of the workplace . It  s really important to remember what your firm  s clothes code is and what it is not ,  says Melissa Hagan , founder and CEO of the clothing company The Hagan Company .  Some firms have dress codes that are more formal than others .  Hagan says that at one of her earlier corporations , the dress code was  business casual ,  which meant that men and ladies were expected to wore button - up shirts and khaki slacks .But at another company , the dress code was  fancy casual ,  which meant that men and ladies were expected to wore button - up shirts and khaki slacks .  It  s really important to remember what your firm  s clothes code is and what it is not ,  says Melissa Hagan , founder and CEO of the clothing company The Hagan Company . Some firms have dress codes that are more formal than others .

Button-down shirts and khaki pants are suitable for both men and women.

CALGARY, Alberta (Reuters) - Encana Corp (ECA.TO), Canadas largest natural gas producer, slashed its 2015 capital budget by a quarter on Wednesday in response to a slump in global crude oil prices.
The
continuation: company announced it now expects to spend C $ 1 . 5 billion ( $ 1 . 11 billion ) on capital projects in 2015 , down from C $ 2 . 2 billion earlier . The Calgary - based company also said it will drop its dividend by 25 percent , or 25 cents per share , to 30 cents per share .Encana  s shares fell as much as 8 percent to C $ 7 . 90 in early trading on the Toronto Stock Exchange .
translation:
CALGARY, Alberta (Reuters) - Encana Corp (ECA.TO), Canada's largest natural gas producer, on Wednesday cut its 2015 capital budget by a quarter as a result of falling global oil prices.
The company announced that it currently plans to spend C$1. $5 billion (US$1.11 billion) was spent on capital projects in 2015, up from CAD2. 2 billion years ago. The Calgary-based company also announced it would cut its dividend by 25%, or 25 cents per share, to 30 cents per share. Encana shares fell as much as 8% to C$7. 90 at the start of trading on the Toronto Stock Exchange.

According to Argentina's Ministry of Foreign Affairs, the victims were Juan Jose Jos Lupez, a businessman from Rosario, Argentina, and his wife, Mara de los Nugueres Lupez, a journalist from Rosario. A total of eight people, including the suspect, were injured in the attack. New York City police said Saipov was driving a rented truck when he struck a pedestrian on a lower Manhattan bike path. He then crashed into a truck stop. Saipov, who was born in Uzbekistan and immigrated to the United States as a child, was on a list of terrorists, the New York Post reported.

"While we are disappointed in this decision, we remain steadfast in our commitment to ensuring affordable and reliable
continuation: access to contraception for all female , " Massachusetts Attorney General Maura Healey told in a statement . " We will continue to work with our federal partners to ensure that all female have access to affordable and reliable access to contraception . "The decision , by U . S . District Court Judge Allison D . Burroughs in Boston , comes after Healey ' s office lawsuits the Trump administration last year , arguing that the administration violated the Religious Freedom Restoration Act by excluding church employers from the contraceptive mandate . The litigation was the first of its kind in the nation , and the decision means that the federal authorities will no longer be able to violate the mandate in Massachusetts .Healey ' s office asserted that the administration ' s exclusion of religious employers from the mandate violates the Religious Freedom Restoration Act , which allows religious organizations from being forced to violate their beliefs in order to obtain state benefits . " This is a major triumph for faith liberty in America , " Healey told in a statement ." The federal authorities should not be able to coerce religious organizations into violating their faith beliefs in order to obtain public benefits . " Healey ' s office is now seeking an appeal of the decision .The Obama administration had expanded the contraceptive mandate to include employers with religious objections to the birth control

continuation: . The department said it will start laying off staff in the last few weeks , with the objective of reaching the objective of cutting 375 positions by the end of the year ." We ' re not looking to cut their pay .We ' re not looking to cut their benefits . We ' re not looking to do anything that ' s going to hurt people . "The department said it will work with affected workers to find other roles within the agency . " We ' ll be looking at every position , " Elia explained ." We ' ll be looking at every job , and we ' ll be looking at every job as an opportunity for us to develop . " We ' re not going to reduce the number of services that we provide .We ' re not going to reduce the number of people that we serve . We ' re not going to reduce the number of children that we serve . "The

input:
ANKARA (Reuters) - For all of Irans fierce verbal response to fresh U.S. threats of tougher sanctions, some senior officials in Tehran believe the door to diplomacy should stay open.
On Monday, U.S. Secretary
continuation: of State John Kerry said the United States was prepared to apply new sanctions on Iran if Tehran did not stop enriching uranium .  The window of diplomacy should not be shut ,  Foreign Minister Mohammad Javad Zarif said on Tuesday . If the door is closed , then we can  t talk to each other ,  Zarif informed a media conference in Tehran .  We can  t talk to the United States if the door is closed ,  he said . The door of diplomacy should not be shut .
translation:
ANKARA (Reuters) - Despite Iran's strong verbal response to renewed U.S. threats to tighten sanctions, some senior officials in Tehran believe the door to diplomacy must remain open.
US Secretary of State John Kerry said on Monday that the US is prepared to impose new sanctions on Iran if it does not stop enriching uranium. Foreign Minister Mohammad Javad Zarif said on Tuesday that the diplomatic window should not be closed. If the door closes, we will not be able to talk to each other, Zarif said at a press conference in Tehran. "You can't have a dialogue with the United States if the door is closed," he said. The door to diplomacy should not be closed.

input:
There is a hearing today on whether presidents should be required to make their tax returns public.
Rep. Richard Neal, D-Mass., then incoming chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee, addressed an audience, Nov. 27, during a gathering
continuation: of the American Israel Public Affairs Committee in Washington , D . C . ( AP Photo / J . Scott Applewhite ) WASHINGTON ( JTA )  U . S . House Ways and Means Committee Chairman Richard Neal , D - Mass . , will hold a hearing Wednesday on whether presidents should be required to make their tax returns public .Neal , who is expected to be re - elected to the post in November , will hold the hearing at 11 a . m . ET at the House headquarters building in Washington , D . C . , according to the commission  s website .The hearing comes amid a heated debate over whether President Donald Trump should be required to release his tax returns , which he has long declined to do . The House Ways and Means Committee , which Neal chairs , passed a resolution in May calling for Trump to release his tax returns .Trump has not released his tax returns since his election in November 2016 . The president has indicated he is under audit by the Internal Revenue Service , which has not answered to a proposal for comment from JTA .
translation:
A hearing will be held today on whether to require the president to release his tax returns.
Rep. Richard Neal (D-Mass.), then the incoming chairman of the House Budget Committee, addresses the audience during the American Israel Public Affairs Committee meeting in Washington, D.C., on November 27. . S. (AP Photo/J. Scott Applewhite) WASHINGTON (JTA) United States. C. House Budget Chairman Richard Neal, Democrat of Massachusetts. Neal is expected to be up for re-election in November, and a public hearing will be held at 11 a.m. ET at House headquarters in Washington, DC. C. This is reported on the Commission's website. The hearing came amid a heated debate over whether President Donald Trump should be required to release his tax returns, which he has long refused to do. In May, the House Budget Committee, which Mr. Neal chairs, passed a resolution calling on Mr. Trump to release his tax returns. Trump has not released his tax returns since the November 2016 election. The president said he is under investigation by the Internal Revenue Service, but he did not respond to JTA's request for comment.

translation:
KISSIMMEE, Fla. (WSVN) - A Vietnam War veteran died before being reunited with his beloved service dog that was stolen from him.
According to Fox 35, 67-year-old Joseph Hanson was hit by a car while walking last week. Hanson was taken to the hospital, where he died from his wounds. His dog, which had been stolen from him, was found in a nearby parking lot. Hanson's parents are hoping someone will come forward with information that could lead to the return of their dog. translation: TAPACHULA, Mexico (AP) - Thousands of Central American migrants resumed the arduous journey to the U.S. border on Monday. Members of the group were furious at suggestions there may be terrorists inside and said the caravan was being used for political purposes. Organizers of the caravan said they expected to reach a key point in their journey and be able to cross the border into Mexico. Many of the migrants, many from Honduras, stopped at a plaza in the southern city of Tapachula to rest after a long day of walking. They said they would continue walking until they reached the border, where they would apply for asylum. We are not terrorists, says Jesus Ramirez, a 23-month-old immigrant from San Pedro Sula, Honduras. He says he is running away from a gang war. . "We are a group of people fleeing violence," he said. We don't want to be terrorists. The caravan left the southern Mexican city of Tapachula and is heading north through Mexico toward the United States. northern border. Mexican authorities have said they will allow the caravan to enter the country if they apply for asylum, but it is unclear how many will apply. The caravan has been met with hostility in Mexico, where many fear it will bring refugees.

Valejah Savon Johnson's argument with Robert Mayes resulted in Mayes clinging to the hood of Johnson's speeding pickup truck, according to affidavit.
LAFAYETTE Twenty-one-year-old Valejah Savon Johnson
continuation: , of Lafayette , was jailed Wednesday after police say he came into an disagreement with a man in a pickup truck and attempted to hit him . Johnson was indicted on accusations of aggravated assault with a lethal gun , criminal mischief and resisting arrest .Police were called to the 100 block of West Fourth Street around 6 : 45 p . m . Wednesday for an disagreement between Johnson and Robert Mayes . Police said Mayes was seated in the driver ' s seat of a pickup truck when Johnson got in the passenger seat and attempted to punch him .Johnson allegedly tried to punch Mayes three times before he getting out of the car and attempted to walk away . Mayes was able to hold onto the hood of Johnson ' s pickup truck , according to the affidavit .Police said Johnson then trying to run away , but Mayes was able to caught him . Mayes telling officers that Johnson hit him in the face with his fist , but Johnson deny that , according to the affidavit .Johnson was booked into the Lafayette Parish Correctional Center . He is being held on a $ 10 , 000 bond .Contact Ashley White at adwhite @ theadvertiser . com or on Twitter @ AshleyyDi . Read or Share this tale :
translation:
According to the affidavit, an altercation between Valeja Sabon Johnson and Robert Mays resulted in Mays clinging to the hood of Johnson's speeding pickup truck.
LAFAYETTE Valeja Sabon Johnson, 21, of Lafayette, was jailed Wednesday after police said she got into an argument with a man in a pickup truck and attempted to hit him. Johnson was charged with aggravated assault with a firearm, criminal mischief and resisting arrest. Police were called to the 100 block of West 4th Street around 6:45 p.m. Wednesday due to a disagreement between Johnson and Robert Mays. Police said Mays was sitting in the driver's seat of the pickup truck when Johnson got into the passenger seat and tried to hit him. Johnson allegedly tried to hit Mays three times before she got out of the car and tried to walk away. Mays was able to cling to the hood of Johnson's pickup truck, the affidavit said. Police said Johnson then tried to run away, but Mays was able to catch him. Mays told officers that Johnson punched her in the face, but Johnson denied it, according to the affidavit. Johnson was booked into the Lafayette Parish Correctional Center. He is being held on $10,000 bail. Contact Ashley White at Adwhite@theadvertiser. com or @AshleyDi on Twitter. translation:
GREENSBURG, Ind. An Indiana man is facing murder charges after he allegedly confessed to killing his girlfriend.
Jason Eaton, 43, entered the Greensburg Police Department Tuesday with a woman and asked to speak to officers. According to a criminal complaint, the man told officers he killed his wife and that he had been fighting with her the night before. The woman told police she had gone to Eaton's apartment the night before and that Eaton had been furious with her. She told police she went to bed and when she woke up she realized it was on her. She told police she pushed her man off her, and he fell to the floor, she said. She told officers that she then tried to stand up and her man pulled her back. She told police she threw the man in the chest, and he fell to the floor, she said. She told her officer that he followed her because she went to the bathroom. She told police he left her bathroom and went to her bedroom. She told officers he went into her kitchen and he was still on top of her. She told officers that when she tried to stand up, he punched her in the face. She told her officer that he followed her because she went to the bathroom. She told officers that the man followed her as she went to her bedroom. She told officers he followed her as she went to the bathroom. She told police she went to the bathroom, but the man followed her.
